entry.title: Add histograms for Zstd Content-Encoding support
entry.content:
This CL adds histograms to log several aspects of zstd-encoded response

streams like compression percent, error codes, and final status of the

filter.



This CL also adds a histogram to log the Content-Encoding type of a

response stream to log how often each of the compression algorithms

are used to compress content in Chromium.



Binary-Size: Added zstd error code.

entry.title: Revert "Clean up proper container in ScreenPinningController"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4ea00587ca58cd9d2734ffe02c8c0521d0618992.



Reason for revert: Culprit of MSan test failures:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/37045/overview

==212665==WARNING: MemorySanitizer: use-of-uninitialized-value

#0 0x5611af2d5eee in RemoveObserverFromChildren ./../../ash/wm/screen_pinning_controller.cc:50:28

#1 0x5611af2d5eee in ash::ScreenPinningController::ResetWindowPinningState() ./../../ash/wm/screen_pinning_controller.cc:288:3

#2 0x5611af2d4d84 in ash::ScreenPinningController::SetPinnedWindow(aura::Window*) ./../../ash/wm/screen_pinning_controller.cc:225:5

#3 0x5611af3ed98b in ash::DefaultState::EnterToNextState(ash::WindowState*, chromeos::WindowStateType,



Original change's description:

> Clean up proper container in ScreenPinningController

>

> The parent container of a pinned window is set up for pinned mode

> in SetPinnedWindow() and cleaned up in ResetWindowPinningState().

>

> These functions need to target the same container but depending

> on the timing of ResetWindowPinningState() being called, the

> pinned window may have already moved to another container at the

> point ResetWindowPinningState() is called and could unexpectedly

> clean up the incorrect container.

>

> With this CL, the container is tracked in ScreenPinningController

> so we can ensure to clean up the proper container.

>

> Bug: b/287903215

> Test: WM CTS dosen't crash.

> Change-Id: I1aa76a399dad0b6713b045390603c0e2c5c5a236

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4672171

entry.title: Fix URL parser to allow "%00" as a valid URL path
entry.content:
This CL is part of the URL interop 2023 effort.



The problem:



Chrome currently considers a URL invalid if the URL's path part

contains "%00" (or null), which is not compliant with the URL Standard

[1]. For example, the following test fails in Chrome because new

URL(..) throws an Invalid URL exception.



assertEquals(new URL("http://example.com/%00").pathname, "/%00");



According to the URL Standard, any character or byte sequence in URL

path should not make the URL invalid.



Interoperability:



- Chrome is the only non-compliant browser, while Firefox and Safari

are compliant.

- I have also tested URL APIs in non-browser environments and

libraries, such as Deno's `URL` implementation [2] and Rust's `url`

crate [3], both of which accept "%00" as a valid URL.



History:



This behavior seems to be a result of past decisions. The comment in

`url_canon_path.cc` states:



> // This table was used to be designed to match exactly what IE did

> // with the characters.



This CL updates the table so that "%00" in URL's path is no longer

considered invalid. Further updates to the table will be addressed as

another issue (https://crbug.com/1252531).



Note that this CL only affects the URL's path. In other parts of URL,

"%00" may still be considered invalid. For example,



new URL("http://example%00.com/")



throws an exception because "%00" is not a valid host codepoint.



Tests:



Updating this behavior requires modifying existing web tests and unit

tests that rely on Chrome's non-compliant behavior.



Some usages of "%00" in unit tests can be replaced with any invalid

URL because their purpose is to represent an invalid URL, such as

"https://example[invalid].com/".



Additionally, some tests can be removed since a URL is never invalid

due to its path part after this CL.



As for WPT tests, all rebaseline are generated using `git cl

rebaseline`, and no manual updates were made to expectation files.

Most rebaselines are understandable, and many WPT tests are now

passing.



The impacts:



A URL path can now include "%00". This may raise concerns.



For websites, how to handle "%00" in the URL's path is up-to each

website. Since they can receive such a URL from other clients than

Chrome, this is not a new issue for most websites.



In term of implementation, web-exported URL APIs, GURL, and KURL share

the same URL parser and canonicalization backend. Another concern is

likely related to Chromium's internal code, which many assume that a

valid URL never contains "%00" in its path.



After this CL, that assumption is no longer true. If necessary,

Chromium's internal code needs to handle NULL in some way when

percent-decoding the URL's path for specific reasons. For example,

this CL updates `FileURLToFilePath` function defined in

`filename_util.cc` so that NULL is handled in this layer.



It is challenging to assess every code path like this since URLs are

widely used, and there may be "Unknown Unknowns". Any ideas on how to

confidently land this CL without causing any breakages are welcome. If

you encounter a null pointer dereference crash and find this CL in the

regression range, this CL might be a culprit.



- [1] https://url.spec.whatwg.org/

- [2] https://deno.land/api@v1.34.3?s=URL

- [3] https://docs.rs/url/latest/url/



Bug: 1400251

Change-Id: Ic2c774835e68f835ff5c9c7e881b6ad6847d17b1

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4596360

Reviewed-by: Orin Jaworski

Reviewed-by: Ryan Hamilton

Reviewed-by: David Dorwin

entry.title: jellyroll shadow [part 1]: add shadow details key
entry.content:
Design doc: go/jellyroll-shadow



Currently, a shadow's appearance is only determined by the shadow

elevation, rounded corner radius, and shadow style (shadow style

determines how the blur radius is calculated). Since we are going

to apply dynamic colors to the shadow, the key and ambient shadow

colors should also be considered, when specifying a shadow.



This cl adds a new ShadowDetailsKey that contains the rounded corner

radius and shadow values. This key includes all the information needed

to determine the appearance of the shadow and will be used as the key

for shadow details cache.



The following cls will apply dynamic colors to the shadow based on

this change.



Test: ShadowUtilTest.ShadowDetailsKey

entry.title: Add feature flag for Zstd Content-Encoding
entry.content:
This CL introduces a net feature: ZstdContentEncoding

When this feature is enabled, the browser will support zstd

content-encoding and send the "zstd" token in the Accept-Encoding

header in Chromium and WebView. The feature is disabled by default.

entry.title: Add a feature that deprioritizes requests from background tabs
entry.content:
An investigation suggested that when the browser has many background

tabs, FCP becomes much slower than when the browser only has the

foreground tab.



This CL adds a feature that deprioritize requests coming from

background tabs to see if deprioritizing background requests could

improve foreground tab page loading.



Googlers: See [1] for details.



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lrcqXZW1h5NkJHCWuwwecXNsV68bU8NU1YpR2OTfI8k/edit?usp=sharing



Bug: 1457817

entry.title: Revert "[FedCM] Fix contrast ratio issue for IDP branding"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 7f894e95556513a6eccc9d99ebe4e02ea180800b.



Reason for revert: Culprit of test failures of

AccountSelectionBubbleViewTest.ContinueButtonWithImproperBackgroundColor

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-chrome/34295/overview



Original change's description:

> [FedCM] Fix contrast ratio issue for IDP branding

>

> We use a minimum contrast ratio to make sure the branding button color

> sufficiently contrasts with the dialog background. However, we are using

> `kMinimumReadableContrastRatio` which is to make sure that the text is

> readable. In fact, we should use `kMinimumVisibleContrastRatio` which is

> to make sure that users can "see it but don't have to read fine detail".

entry.title: Add Zstandard Content-Encoding support
entry.content:
This CL pulls the zstd library[1] into third_party/zstd via DEPS, and

adds Accept-Encoding and Content-Encoding support.



This means that Chrome can now send "zstd" as a token in the

Accept-Encoding request header, and decompress with Zstandard[2]

when the "zstd" token is seen in the Content-Encoding response

header. This will be enabled only when |enable_zstd| is set to true

in the NetworkContextParams.



[1] https://github.com/facebook/zstd

[2] https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8878



Binary-Size: Added the zstd library.

entry.title: Resetting Hovercard image preview pref to default state
entry.content:
We enabled the hovercard setting for a brief period in Canary and Dev

channels and noticed a small number of users enabled it on MacOS which

resulted in a spike in crashes due to graphics drivers incompatibilities

(a known issue being worked on separately). To mitigate against this, we

are renaming the pref to reset its state and will no be rolling out the

settings to MacOS until the crash issue is fixed. Only downside to this

change is some users on Windows who might have disabled the Hovercard

image previews might have to redo it again.

entry.title: WebNN: Define the GraphBuilder for DirectML backend
entry.content:
This CL mainly defines GraphBuilder which is a helper class to build

a DML graph. It provides methods to create the input and operator

nodes. The input edges and intermediate deges are created when creating

operator nodes, and the output edges are created at last to indicate

which node's output is graph's output. IDMLDevice::CompileOperator() or

IDMLDevice1::CompileGraph() will be called in GraphBuilder::Compile()

to compile the graph or operator.



This CL also defines NodeInfo, NodeOutputInfo and NodeOutput which are

used by GraphBuilder. The NodeInfo represents the info of a node. The

NodeOutputInfo represents the info of a node output. The NodeOutput

is created from a node, it represents an output of a node.



Some unit tests for building a DML graph with relu, split and conv2d

operators are added to ensure the correctness of GraphBuilder. These

tests have covered building both single-operator and multiple-operators

graphs.



Bug: 1273291

Change-Id: I5754d77e39cf6a21ed7b77deaf3970d145a2d775

entry.title: [wpt-importer] File bugs by most specific DIR_METADATA, not OWNERS
entry.content:
Currently, failing imported tests are grouped by most specific OWNERS

file for notification. However, some WPT directories only have

DIR_METADATA and not OWNERS; failures in these directories will not get

any notifications, even if the DIR_METADATA has opted in.



This change groups failures by most specific DIR_METADATA instead, since

DIR_METADATA are generally better maintained and hold information for

filing bugs. The team email is now CC'ed (if available), but continue

CC'ing OWNERS from the same directory (if available). For most top-level

directories with both DIR_METADATA and OWNERS, this notification

behavior represents no change.



Update the documentation accordingly.

entry.content:
Now that js_browsertest.cc is no longer auto-generated by

js2gtest, a simpler pattern can be used that does not require each test

case to use a different C++ class name.



Example renames:

- IconModuleTest.All -> WebUiJsTest.Icon

- PromiseResolverModuleTest.All -> WebUiJsTest.PromiseResolver

- UtilModuleTest.All -> WebUiJsTest.Util



Where the somewhat meaningless "*.All" naming pattern is now unnecessary. This also makes it possible to run all such tests, for

example by passing `--gtest_filter=WebUiJsTest.*` which was previously

not possible.

entry.title: Revert "[omnibox] Instantiate presenter with webui omnibox popup view, etc."
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4de5ce643f0c76315962806a30ebd2c1bd8c5683.



Reason for revert: Suspicious about causing test failures of interactive_ui_tests MenuItemViewTestInsert02.InsertItem02.

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests%20(Wayland)/39788/overview

With no confidence. Just because only this patch looks relevant to the test within the commit range.



Original change's description:

> [omnibox] Instantiate presenter with webui omnibox popup view, etc.

>

> This CL does 3 things: expands lifetime, holds open for devtools, and

> significantly upgrades testability of the webui omnibox popup view.

>

> First, it expands the lifetime of OmniboxPopupPresenter to that of the

> owning OmniboxPopupViewWebUI instead of instantiating on demand during

> updates. This fixes an issue where initial input and suggestions were

> not shown by the popup.

>

> Additionally, this CL considers the devtools status before closing the

> popup so the native view can be inspected. See for more context:

> https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4643132/comments/ac88c013_90e2aa58

>

> Finally, this CL makes it possible to cleanly test the webui omnibox

> popup view by first waiting for the webui handler to become available

> and bound by the remote. Before this blocking mechanism was

> implemented, there were various failure modes relating to the webui

> handler, particularly absence before navigation, and then even when

> it was present, calls could be made before the remote was bound, which

> would also cause crashes. Now it reliably navigates, binds, and works!

>

> Bug: 1458266, 1396174

> Change-Id: I1ef77ccb3f288aabafbfff75ff0e7df7fb7bde24

entry.title: Introduce NamedMojoMessagePipeServer
entry.content:
NamedMojoIpcServer was used by Chromoting to handle incoming IPCs via

the named pipe, however, we have recently changed our multi-process

architecture a bit, such that the server is run on one process, while

mojo binding happens on another process. NamedMojoIpcServer does both

endpoint connection and mojo binding, so it no longer suits our use

case.



This CL factors out a NamedMojoMessagePipeServer class from

NamedMojoIpcServer, which only does the endpoint connection job. Rather

than binding the message pipe to an implementation, this class just

passes the mojo message pipe via a callback. Chromoting code will then

pass the message pipe to and bind it on the right process.



Bug: 1378803

Change-Id: I566bee861e1ad33671a7bea1211e33c8fd482673

entry.title: Clean up proper container in ScreenPinningController
entry.content:
The parent container of a pinned window is set up for pinned mode

in SetPinnedWindow() and cleaned up in ResetWindowPinningState().



These functions need to target the same container but depending

on the timing of ResetWindowPinningState() being called, the

pinned window may have already moved to another container at the

point ResetWindowPinningState() is called and could unexpectedly

clean up the incorrect container.



With this CL, the container is tracked in ScreenPinningController

so we can ensure to clean up the proper container.



Bug: b/287903215

entry.title: Don't call MapLocalToRemoteMainFrame on non-local-roots
entry.content:
FrameView::MapLocalToRemoteMainFrame() is called from

LayoutView::MapAncestorToLocal() when the frame has no owner layout

object, implying that the frame is a local root. However, in some

layout tests with RenderDocument (LocalFrame <-> LocalFrame swap on

navigation) enabled, we see cases where a non-local-root subframe has

no owner layout object and mistaken as local root, leading to a

DCHECK failure in FrameView::MapLocalToRemoteMainFrame(). This CL

fixes this by adding a local root check before calling that function.



See also: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1blFmpdeC7E76S_SLaNrXKiqgB2WZ3leQmhmjCioKZAk/edit#heading=h.x98ntr5cl4gs

entry.title: "Correct" the class hierarchy for DOM Parts
entry.content:
The prior hierarchy was a bit wonky:



PartRoot (getParts, clone)

/ \

DocumentPartRoot Part (root, metadata)

/ \

NodePart (node) ChildNodePart (prev/next/etc)



This was funny because a Part was a PartRoot, but kind of not always,

since a NodePart isn't really a PartRoot. That hierarchy was used

to avoid the inconvenience that multiple inheritance isn't a thing

for JS. This CL updates the class hierarchy to implement PartRoot as

a JS interface mixin, with the C++ implementation in a single PartRoot

base class shared by DocumentPartRoot and ChildNodePart. So the new

C++ class hierarchy looks like this:



Part PartRoot

/ \ / \

NodePart ChildNodePart DocumentPartRoot



This should make future additions (such as the ability to clone

ChildNodeParts) less painful.



Bug: 1453291

Change-Id: I1c3e820fc6d76aa56dcf3a2e0f26cfc6ab30f3e2

entry.title: Ensure Windows System Proxy Resolver sandbox calls LowerToken()
entry.content:
The code for this sandbox followed the patterns established by the Media

Foundation CDM sandbox, but a mistake was made where the former sandbox

followed the the latter in skipping a call to

`TargetServices::LowerToken()`, which drops higher privileges from the

new sandboxed process. The CDM sandbox can do this because it calls

`LowerToken()` later on, but that isn't the case for the proxy

resolution sandbox.



This change addresses the problem by removing the exclusion for the

proxy sandbox in the standard place where sandboxed processes call

`TargetServices::LowerToken()`. It also separates out the proxy sandbox

in one other location where it is bundled a little too closely with the

CDM sandbox, which could lead to another similar class of problem in the

future.



Bug: 1032820

Change-Id: I6ff541b893e2ee31feed090a8b17479a657eaf69

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4647953

entry.title: RELAND: media/gpu/v4l2: configure V4L2StatefulVideoDecoder CAPTURE queue
entry.content:
This CL continues implementing V4L2StatefulVideoDecoder, concretely the

configuration and pre-filling of the |CAPTURE_queue_| (which will hold

decoded video pictures).



It basically follows the V4L2 spec plus the necessary interactions with

VideoDecoderPipeline:

- InitializeCAPTUREQueue() creates |CAPTURE_queue_| and queries some

info, e.g. codec size, visible rect, or number of desired reference

frames for the given codec (this latter number has some sanitization

so it's done in a new method GetNumberOfReferenceFrames()).

- InitializeCAPTUREQueue() then enumerates all |CAPTURE_queue_| possible

pixel formats and asks its |client_| (VideoDecoderPipeline) to

PickDecoderOutputFormat(). VDPipeline then figures out if any candidate

is preferred and if it needs an ImageProcessor to adapt formats (mt8173)

or not (qualcomm).

- InitializeCAPTUREQueue() finally tells |CAPTURE_queue_| to Allocate()

a number of buffers; the allocation, and the type of buffer, depends on

whether |CAPTURE_queue_| has to feed the whole Media pipeline, or just

VDPipeline's ImageProcessor (see |use_v4l2_allocated_buffers|).



With this, both queues are initialized and ready to go. Next CLs will

start grabbing decoded picture frames out of |CAPTURE_queue_| and

sending them to |client_|, etc.



Tested on hana and trogdor via:

/usr/local/libexec/chrome-binary-tests/video_decode_accelerator_tests /usr/local/share/tast/data_pushed/go.chromium.org/tast-tests/cros/local/bundles/cros/video/data/test-25fps.vp8 '--vmodule=*/media/gpu/v4l2/*=4' --gtest_filter=*.Decode:*.FlushAtEndOfStream --enable-features=V4L2FlatStatefulVideoDecoder



Bug: b:279980150

Change-Id: Ib8b80b257d488aed1ab059a55bb4cfb48215c292

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4675677

entry.title: Move popover invoker CHECK
entry.content:
I added this CHECK in http://crrev.com/1166594 but it will get hit when

showPopover is called while the popover is open with an invoker. This

patch moves the CHECK down past the IsPopoverReady check to avoid

getting hit. If the popover is already open, then the IsPopoverReady

check will return before the CHECK is run.



The motivation behind the CHECK is still fine - it ensures that while

the popover is closed, it can't have an invoker set.

entry.title: Remove a reachable NOTREACHED() in formStateRestoreCallback
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/4541642 assumed that ElementInternals cannot have a null

value and a non-null state at the same time, and added a NOTREACHED()

for that situation, which is wrong. However, it still handles the case

correctly in production builds where the NOTREACHED() is ignored.



So this patch simply removes the NOTREACHED() and adds a test case.



Fixed: 1462111

entry.title: [FedCM] Fix contrast ratio issue for IDP branding
entry.content:
We use a minimum contrast ratio to make sure the branding button color

sufficiently contrasts with the dialog background. However, we are using

`kMinimumReadableContrastRatio` which is to make sure that the text is

readable. In fact, we should use `kMinimumVisibleContrastRatio` which is

to make sure that users can "see it but don't have to read fine detail".



Bug: 1463020

Change-Id: I316166b3fc351ad79863fd16dd12165cd906f5cf

entry.title: Reject when `navigator.storage.estimate()` fails to calculate usage
entry.content:
Previously an error in retrieving buckets would return a usage of -1

(which is later converted to an unsigned integer, so is reported as

2^64). This changes QuotaManagerImpl logic to report an error which

ultimately causes the promise to reject.



This also changes the type of the rejection to be a TypeError instead of

a DOMException to match the spec:

https://storage.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-storagemanager-estimate



Bug: 1451614

Change-Id: I2c23f5403e5410298e6279ea4982c1ad2b9b30a0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4666778

entry.title: Update Desktop Capture Histograms
entry.content:
Updates OWNER of a few histograms from auorion@ who has stopped actively

working on the project.



Updates the DesktopCapture*FrameTime histogram to expire 6 months in the

future as it is still used for some rollout metrics of the WGC capturer.

entry.title: Add feature to merge subprocess metrics asynchronously
entry.content:
The feature, when enabled, allows enabling certain async behaviours

through params:

- The "PeriodicMergeAsync" param makes merging subprocess metrics for

periodic ongoing logs asynchronously.

(See SubprocessMetricsProvider::MergeHistogramDeltas()).

- The "DeregisterAsync" param makes merging the metrics of exiting

subproccesses asynchronously.

(See SubprocessMetricsProvider::DeregisterSubprocessAllocator()).

- The "DeregisterSequenced" param determines whether the tasks

for this are sequenced.



This (unfortunately?) uses refcounting. However, since the reference

counts are only modified on the same sequence (main thread), this uses

RefCounted (and not ThreadSafeRefCounted). Initially, I manually kept

track of a count of how many background tasks were pending to detect

when to release the allocators, but the code was pretty much just me

implementing my own refcounting, so I just used RefCounted instead

(which simplified the implementation a lot).



In terms of thread safety, this should be fine to do. In particular,

the background tasks will iterate through shared memory segments to

find histograms. It will snapshot them (which was made threadsafe

in a previous CL through atomics and locks: crrev.com/c/4346077),

and then merge them with the SR histograms (which should be threadsafe

since it is pretty much equivalent to just emitting a histogram).

entry.title: [omnibox] Instantiate presenter with webui omnibox popup view, etc.
entry.content:
This CL does 3 things: expands lifetime, holds open for devtools, and

significantly upgrades testability of the webui omnibox popup view.



First, it expands the lifetime of OmniboxPopupPresenter to that of the

owning OmniboxPopupViewWebUI instead of instantiating on demand during

updates. This fixes an issue where initial input and suggestions were

not shown by the popup.



Additionally, this CL considers the devtools status before closing the

popup so the native view can be inspected. See for more context:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4643132/comments/ac88c013_90e2aa58



Finally, this CL makes it possible to cleanly test the webui omnibox

popup view by first waiting for the webui handler to become available

and bound by the remote. Before this blocking mechanism was

implemented, there were various failure modes relating to the webui

handler, particularly absence before navigation, and then even when

it was present, calls could be made before the remote was bound, which

would also cause crashes. Now it reliably navigates, binds, and works!



Bug: 1458266, 1396174

entry.title: bento_button: Add focus support to the new desk bar
entry.content:
This change adds focus support to the new desk bar. The new bar will use

the default focus manager from the view tree, while the overview bar

will continue to use a customized overview highlight controller.



Please note that this change introduces the following differences in bar

behaviors:

- When tabbing in the desk name view, the overview bar only highlights

the view, but does not focus. The new bar will focus directly.

- When committing a name change for the desk name view, the overview

bar uses a cached highlighted view to re-claim focus to re-edit. The

new bar does not support this.

entry.title: ReportConfiguration Create refactoring
entry.content:
This is a readability improvement.

Using this pattern, `ReportConfiguration::Create` can mostly be called

with one parameter only - Settings. The actual parameters then appear with their names, and we can skip some that are defaults. C++ allows to change their order as well, but Lint does not accept that.



Unfortunately, non-trivial parameters (callbacks, smart pointers)

do not compile if added to Settings. To overcome this limitation,

I made `ReportConfiguration::Create` return Builder instance, that

has setters for those parameters too. Once everything is set, `Build`

method needs to be called to produce `StatusOr`.



Legacy `ReportConfiguration::Create` is preserved too, so no

backwards compatibility issues should surface.



Bug: None

Change-Id: I76b350b439ef2012d11773b42b7209033a9ea7b5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4671689

entry.title: Remove incorrect DCHECKs/NOTREACHED()
entry.content:
- In histogram.cc and sparse_histogram.cc, there's an incorrect

DCHECK. It asserts that if a histogram couldn't be allocated, it

means there was no persistent histogram allocator. But it could just

mean the allocator was full. (The comment above it was correct).



- There's a NOTREACHED() when trying to allocate a new sample for

sparse histograms (persistent_sample_map.cc), but the allocation

fails. Don't call NOTREACHED() if it's full since that's a real

possibility.

entry.title: [Auto-disable Accessibility] Add a ConfigurationUtils class
entry.content:
This CL continues work on consolidating all accessibility state code

in Clank to a single source of truth.



With this CL we create a ConfigurationUtils class and move a method

of AccessibilityUtils to this new class.



Users may be attaching external keyboards for accessibility purposes,

and so adding this to AccessibilityState may seem like a natural step,

but the Configuration does not behave like the system accessibility

properties. To check the keyboard status we need to fetch it from the

Context's Resources.



There is not a clean way to add the static AccessibilityState class

as an Observer of the Activity's onConfigurationChange. So the current

state stored in AccessibilityState may become stale unless we add a

public method and allow a Configuration observer in the //chrome/

layer to drive those updates (e.g. AsyncInitializationActivity,

ActivityLifecycleDispatcherImpl, etc). Alternatively we could use a

similar approach as AccessibilityUtil and add a dependency in

AccessibilityState on content.res.Configuration, and require all

callers to pass a Configuration or fetch it in AccessibilityState.

Since both cases would be fetching the Configuration from ContextUtils's

ApplicationContext, it seems cleaner to do that in one place and allow

all interested clients to simply call:



ConfigurationUtils.isHardwareKeyboardAttached().



AX-Relnotes: N/A

Bug: 1430202, b/265493191

kIPHExtensionsMenuFeature

the bug where kIPHExtensionsMenuFeature was shown for the incorrect

extensions toolbar button state, since UpdateAllIcons() is triggered

many times.

scrolling contents caused the background to cover the inset part of
